intro: Pycreus flavescens subsp. microglumis, commonly known as the small-leaved pycreus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems. The subspecies is distinguished by its smaller, more densely packed leaves compared to other subspecies of Pycreus. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in umbels, and it blooms during the spring and early summer. This plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
